title: Is it worth startin long animes @ tis point?

replies.body: start one piece or conan detective i dare you LOL
replies.body_tagged: start one piece or conan detective i dare you LOL

replies.body: I personally don't find it worth the time to watch anime that are already hundreds of episodes long and/or too mainstream, like the ones you listed... though Code Geass shouldn't count as one, since it only has two seasons so far. The most I've seen were fifty-two episodes of the Fate series (highly, highly recommended), but those were spread out between separate shows 窶能u0026nbsp; Fate/Zero and Fate/stay night [Unlimited Blade Works], plus a few special episodes.
replies.body_tagged: I personally don't find it worth the time to watch anime that are already hundreds of episodes long and/or too mainstream, like the ones you listed... though Code Geass shouldn't count as one, since it only has two seasons so far. The most I've seen were fifty-two episodes of the Fate series (highly, highly recommended), but those were spread out between separate shows 窶能u0026nbsp; Fate/Zero and Fate/stay night [Unlimited Blade Works], plus a few special episodes.

replies.body: If you do. Do it at a time when you don't have a lot to do for a few days. If you are like me you will get stuck on a series and you can't do anything else until you finish it.
replies.body_tagged: If you do. Do it at a time when you don't have a lot to do for a few days. If you are like me you will get stuck on a series and you can't do anything else until you finish it.

replies.body: finished both, Fate/Zero was a little better than UBW for me, atleast the 1st half, but the last fight scene on UBW was top notch but a little cheesy on the end of the fight
